definitions.definition: a book forming part of a work or series.
a single book or a bound collection of printed sheets.
examples: book, publication, tome, hardback, paperback, title; Moremanual, almanac, compendium "a volume from the library"Moremanual, almanac, compendium a volume from the library

definitions.definition: a consecutive sequence of issues of a periodical.
a scroll of parchment or papyrus containing written matter.
the amount of space that a substance or object occupies, or that is enclosed within a container, especially when great.
examples: the sewer could not cope with the volume of rainwater
synonyms: measurements "a glass syringe of known volume"

definitions.definition: the amount or quantity of something, especially when great.
examples: changes in the volume of consumer spending

definitions.definition: a certain, typically large amount of something.
examples: the volumes of data handled are vast

definitions.definition: fullness or expansive thickness of something, especially of a person's hair.
quantity or power of sound; degree of loudness.
examples: he turned the volume up on the radio
synonyms: amplification; informaldecibels "she turned the volume down"
